thread.title: Democrats can’t stop happy-tweeting about Republicans’ failed health-care bill
thread.title_full: Democrats can’t stop happy-tweeting about Republicans’ failed health-care bill - The Washington Post

author: washingtonpost blogs
title: Democrats can’t stop happy-tweeting about Republicans’ failed health-care bill
text:
March 24 at 4:21 PM Follow PeterWStevenson White House press secretary Sean Spicer repeatedly asserted that President Trump has done "everything" to try to pass the GOP-proposed American Health Care Act during his briefing on March 24 at the White House. (Peter Stevenson/The Washington Post) It's clear that the Republican-proposed American Health Care Act won't go to a vote Friday — and perhaps, in its current form, never will.
And Democrats are thrilled.
They had argued for weeks that the GOP legislation would make insurance plan prices skyrocket, and take insurance away from millions of Americans with preexisting conditions. Republicans have a majority in the House, but enough of them opposed the bill that it stood no chance of passing. That's why President Trump asked House leaders to pull the bill just before the vote was scheduled at 3:30 p.m. Friday.
A video taken by Rep. Brenda Lawrence (D-Mich.) in the halls of the Capitol shows Democrats beaming, laughing and clapping:
Republican #TrumpCare bill pulled. #ThePeopleSpoke pic.twitter.com/RRK4yAVCXb
— Brenda Lawrence (@RepLawrence) March 24, 2017
And a whole bunch of other Democrats took to Twitter to express their glee:
Hey Republicans, don't worry, that burn is covered under the Affordable Care Act
— Senator Bob Menendez (@SenatorMenendez) March 24, 2017
It's over (for now). A tremendous victory for the American people. Trump and Ryan have learned a lesson: we're not going backwards. pic.twitter.com/PA6d0uA0Fr
— Rep. Jamie Raskin (@RepRaskin) March 24, 2017
The defeat of the disastrous Trump-Ryan health care bill is a major victory for working families and everyone who stood up in opposition.
— Bernie Sanders (@SenSanders) March 24, 2017
GOP pulled #Trumpcare ! Huge thanks to all of you who called and wrote to Congress in record numbers to help keep American health care safe.
— Judy Chu (@RepJudyChu) March 24, 2017
Sometimes the people win! Power to the people! https://t.co/dzp5GhRbye
— Steve Cohen (@RepCohen) March 24, 2017
This is because of people like you raising your voices, making yourselves heard, and rising up to own our democracy. https://t.co/n7cYtotZpP
— Kirsten Gillibrand (@SenGillibrand) March 24, 2017
To every single person who called their Representative, attended a town hall, and made their voice heard--you made a difference #KillTheBill pic.twitter.com/ScaXqCvaNf
— Gregory Meeks (@GregoryMeeks) March 24, 2017
While this fight is far from over, today affirms that your voice matters. https://t.co/sjXm8OAzYs
— Kamala Harris (@KamalaHarris) March 24, 2017
Breaking News: Enough Republicans agree #TrumpCare is bad for patients across the country and cancel the health care bill vote for now.
— Raul Ruiz (@CongressmanRuiz) March 24, 2017
Repealing #ACA and putting discrimination back into #healthcare is a backward step history will not forgive. #KillTheBill
— James E. Clyburn (@Clyburn) March 24, 2017
GOP pulled Trumpcare when they lacked votes-you can fool all of the people some of the time & some of the people all the time-but not today!
— Ben Ray Lujan (@repbenraylujan) March 24, 2017
VICTORY as Republicans have failed to overturn Obamacare pic.twitter.com/1ZceKsPyJz
— Adriano Espaillat (@RepEspaillat) March 24, 2017
Thank you to everyone who contacted my office in opposition to Trumpcare. Keep calling & stay engaged.
— Dina Titus (@repdinatitus) March 24, 2017
Republicans just gave up on Trumpcare! BIG victory for the American people!
— David Cicilline (@davidcicilline) March 24, 2017
GOP must fully absorb the message sent loud & clear by grassroots America and echoed in today's failure: Stop playing games with health care pic.twitter.com/AQZdm0B1JM
— Senator Jeff Merkley (@SenJeffMerkley) March 24, 2017
Your calls, emails, & letters worked. Speaking out at town halls worked. The GOP pulled their bad bill b/c you spoke out. We can’t stop now!
— Mike Thompson (@RepThompson) March 24, 2017
Overwhelmingly the American people have voiced their opposition to #Trumpcare and their voices were heard.
— Rep. Val Demings (@RepValDemings) March 24, 2017
Most of all, I'm happy for the millions of Americans who will now keep their health insurance.
— Brendan Boyle (@RepBrendanBoyle) March 24, 2017
Your energy and passion made all the difference -- together we were able to #KillTheBill & defeat #TrumpCare . Stay loud.
— Rep. Eric Swalwell (@RepSwalwell) March 24, 2017
Now let's declare victory for the American people, especially for the 24 million who would have lost their health care if #Trumcare passed.
— Rep. Hank Johnson (@RepHankJohnson) March 24, 2017
Now let's declare victory for the American people, especially for the 24 million who would have lost their health care if #Trumcare passed.
— Rep. Hank Johnson (@RepHankJohnson) March 24, 2017
"I call my own shots." - @realDonaldTrump , 2/6/17
Ryan made me do it - West Wing spin, 3/24/17 #TrumpCare #KillTheBill pic.twitter.com/E82En6GpUY
— Donald Payne Jr. (@RepDonaldPayne) March 24, 2017
Republicans promised for SEVEN years. pic.twitter.com/mTIzZyEdWa
— Ways and Means Dems (@WaysMeansCmte) March 24, 2017
"Republicans could talk the talk, but couldn't walk the walk." #TrumpCare pic.twitter.com/wPRdF8AeSU
— Rep. Marc Veasey (@RepVeasey) March 24, 2017
They've pulled the bill. They don't have the votes. This is a win for the American people . WATCH & SHARE MY VIDEO UPDATE on #Trumpcare pic.twitter.com/7tBn3co71v
— Chellie Pingree (@chelliepingree) March 24, 2017
. @POTUS spoke to @TIME this week: "I can't be doing so badly, because I'm president, and you're not." The #Resistance would say otherwise. pic.twitter.com/qnHILBzFTJ
— Dwight Evans (@RepDwightEvans) March 24, 2017
pic.twitter.com/srEBRHu1ZX
— Matt Thornton (@thorntonmh) March 24, 2017
